hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave and this is

30th 2017 and the top of the episode is
indicators are popping up all over the
place warning that the economy is about
to implode now before I get started I
just want to make an announcement I
uploaded an interview with Jim Willie it
is on the X 20 to report spotlight
YouTube channel so you can go over to

you can also see the interview on the X
22 airport comm and new central.com
websites just scroll down look over your

there or you can go to steam it and you
can view the interview on steam Ian and
I have another announcement thank you
for all those people who have been
writing the emails asking if I was okay
everything is fine I was just visiting
family and the timeframe of doing the
report and getting to family and doing
everything just didn't work out and
that's why there was no report on Friday
I thought I was going to be able to have
time but it just didn't work out and
that's why I'm doing a full report on
Sunday but once again thank you for
everyone that's been writing in and
asking if everything is okay everything
is absolutely fine thank you let's get
into the economic collapse financial
news now as we can see from all the data
that we've been looking at I mean if you
listen to the corporate media it's
completely different if you listen to
the US government it is completely
different if you listen to the Fed it's
completely different but when we're
looking at all the economic data what
are we seeing we're seeing the economy
completely slowed down the human
consumer confidence while that data is
showing us that the trend is slowing
right now it printed at ninety three
point four this is the lowest since
October of 2016 right before the
elections and the biggest driver of the
decline was a tumbling expectation index
people are not expecting the economy to
get any better right now and there are
certain signs that actually point to
this as being the real thing and we've
been looking at many different
indicators we've been looking at many
different signs we'll be looking at many
different aspects of the economy and we
start to put
these things together and we do see the
economy starting to implode on itself
now the last two times Americans were
saving the amount that they are saving
today
which is maybe a little bit more to
maintain their lifestyles the US economy
was in a recession right now American
households they scale back their pace of
savings to the lowest level in nine
years this is the lowest reading since a
2.8 percent rate in the final three
quarters of 2007 just as the US was
entering a recession now that is a sign
once again now it's not like we're just
looking at one indicator we're looking
at many different ones and putting them
all together and when you start to look
at all of them and you start to say okay
this one is saying we're in a recession
because it happened last time
corporate tax receipts they're declining
this is what happened in the last
recession state tax receipts are
declining this is what happened in last
recession GDP numbers lower even though
they're manipulated they're lower this
is what happened in the last recession
people losing jobs left and right this
is what happened in the last recession
corporate debt rising this is what
happened in the last recession when we
start to look at all this and we keep
seeing the same patterns over and over
it tells us something but again the US
government the Fed those who are in
power they like to change history they
like to go back in time and basically
revise or manipulate the numbers even
more to make it look like everything was
fine at a certain period of time and
they're doing this today now if we go
back in time we can see that they've
been playing around with GDP numbers and
what's very interesting is that the
numbers under Donald Trump's presidency
they were all revised lower or right
before he became president now one
amusing finding here is that the
following revisions in the third quarter
is now said to have been 5.2 percent
while the first quarter of 2015 that GDP
number which was blamed on you know the
really bad weather we had a lot of snow
and things like that they pushed that up
to 3.2 percent now that was under
President Obama so they're going back in
time and they're pushing these numbers
up and making it seem like the economy
was incredible at that time now remember
back in January of 2015 after we had a
lot of heavy snow cold weather across
the country and a lot of cities were
getting hit the first quarter GDP s that
was a disaster now the Wall Street
Journal they came out saying yeah GDP is
not going to be looking good basically
this is what they said brace for
blizzards and other bad weather to hit
the economy again this winter though
perhaps not as deeply as last year the
forecasting firm macro economic advisors
on Thursday said heavy snowfall pounding
the Northeast and parts of the Midwest
will subtract point 4 percentage points
from the gross domestic product growth
in the first quarter now Forbes came out
and said you know many economists
investors are pointing to us know we
went to worry whether this is why we're
hitting this weakness and all this came
out to be true the GDP numbers came out
and the US economy only grew by 0.2
percent this is what they released yes
they go back and they say okay we have
to adjust for seasonal you know
anomalies and things like that which are
you know they're seasonal adjustments
and they brought it up a little bit but
that year they said well we're going to
do a double seasonal adjustment to
eliminate what just happened here which
really what they were trying to say is
they wanted to bring the numbers way way
up so basically they brought these
numbers in the first quarter of 2015
they brought the number all the way up
to three point two percent so now we're
starting to get readings during Obama's

lot better than it really was because
now people going to look back in history
and all they're going to see are those
numbers outlook the first quarter of
2015 we had a 3.20 this quarter we had a
four point
zero percent this quarter we have five
percent so unless you're comparing

icos

ad for icos
because think about it if they're all

they can't touch it and you can sign up

maybe a lot of people are selling their

people have been seeing the market go up

all of a sudden RV sales go up and all

and we
seeing this pattern over and over now
the RV sales today in 2016 going into

really feel comfortable people think

if you look at this

when people feel comfortable about the

this is nothing new and it always ends

this is what they state are considering

whatever they want we're temporarily off
